title: Our 15 Favorite Reformation Pieces, From Wedding Guest Dresses to Swimwear
description: Reformation is a brand that's hard not to know. The sustainable Los Angeles-based fashion label is adored by the likes of Kendall Jenner, Meghan Markle, and Taylor Swift - along with countless others, including PS editors, and most likely, you. The brand's repertoire isn't known for just one thing. While its dresses are the ultimate fan-favorite, Reformation's influence stretches far beyond that, with must haves in every category, from tops and bottoms to footwear, accessories, jewelry, and even the bestselling, '90s-inspired Cary jeans. But with price tags that mostly land in the three dollar sign-range, a full Reformation shopping spree isn't always realistic. That's why we're all about choosing the right pieces and why we've curated this guide to the brand's bestsellers for every Reformation lover, new or seasoned. Ahead, we've rounded up the 15 best Reformation pieces to consider coveting for fall, from everyday dresses that'll take you from the office to happy hour and wedding guest dresses to tops that are perfect for layering. We even included options at a range of price points, along with PS editor favorites, styles in trending prints, and more. Keep scrolling to shop our selects.
author: Marisa Petrarca
excerpt: We curated a shopping guide to the best Reformation pieces of the season.

While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Reformation is a brand that's hard not to know. The sustainable Los Angeles-based fashion label is adored by the likes of Kendall Jenner, Meghan Markle, and Taylor Swift — along with countless others, including PS editors, and most likely, you. The brand's repertoire isn't known for just one thing. While its dresses are the ultimate fan-favorite, Reformation's influence stretches far beyond that, with must haves in every category, from tops and bottoms to footwear, accessories, jewelry, and even the bestselling, '90s-inspired Cary jeans. But with price tags that mostly land in the three dollar sign-range, a full Reformation shopping spree isn't always realistic. That's why we're all about choosing the right pieces and why we've curated this guide to the brand's bestsellers for every Reformation lover, new or seasoned.

Ahead, we've rounded up the 15 best Reformation pieces to consider coveting for fall, from everyday dresses that'll take you from the office to happy hour and wedding guest dresses to tops that are perfect for layering. We even included options at a range of price points, along with PS editor favorites, styles in trending prints, and more. Keep scrolling to shop our selects.

Best Knit Top From Reformation

Reformation Dusk Knit Top ($58)

This sleeveless fitted knit top is the kind of wardrobe staple you'll want in every color. It boasts lightweight, stretchy fabric that pairs perfectly with everything, from baggy jeans to skirts and beyond.

Best Swimsuit Bottom From Reformation

Reformation Faro Bikini Bottom ($98)

Reformation revamped its swimwear line, and PS editors were among the first to test them out. While all pieces in the collection are covetable for any vacations you're taking, this one stands out for its chic, retro-inspired design. Check this one out and more in our review of Reformation swimwear.

Editor Quote: "As a city girl, I take my beach days seriously. I typically like to spend hours by the water, so my swimwear has to be comfortable to lay and tan in all day, and hold up for frequent dips in the ocean. This retro-inspired swim set passed the test and more, making it one of my favorite pieces of swimwear to date. The brand's new eco fabric felt both soft and stretchy, and the halter neckline made the suit very sunbathing-friendly, though it's worth noting it may lack support for those with larger chests (it has no underwire or molded cups). It also changed my mind about swim bottoms — I usually prefer a high-cut style, but I found these boy shorts to be so flattering and fun." — Yerin Kim, former editor, Features

Best Going-Out Top From Reformation

Reformation Melanie Top ($148)

We probably don't need to tell you how obsession-worthy this top is. Whether you're wearing it on a date night or out dancing with friends, it's guaranteed to turn heads and spark questions about where you got it. It comes in neutrals like the black and white option pictured here, as well as more colorful ones like this deep red style ($148).

Best Earrings From Reformation

Reformation x Clare Waight Keller Bechet Earrings ($168)

Reformation dropped its first-ever limited-edition, vintage-inspired jewelry collection, created in collaboration with fashion designer Clare Waight Keller. These sleek huggie hoops with bold geometric links are one of our favorites from the collection.

Best Cashmere Sweater From Reformation

Reformation Cashmere Boyfriend Sweater ($178)

If you're always ready to invest in a cashmere sweater, you can't go wrong with this Reformation bestseller. It's soft, lightweight, boasts a relaxed fit, and comes in both solids and stripes. We love that it's made from 95 percent recycled cashmere, too. What's not to love?

Best Jeans From Reformation

Reformation Cary Low Rise Slouchy Wide Leg Jeans ($178)

Reformation's Cary jeans are a fan-favorite among shoppers, and occasionally the brand comes out with on-trend versions for the season, like this vented and studded pair ($218). There's also a leopard-print pair ($198), if that's more your style. Read more in our Reformation Cary Jeans review.

Editor Quote:: "As someone who's 5'1", I do wish the Cary came in a petite variation — but in my opinion, that's all that's missing here. Everything else — from the comfort to the subtle stretch to the eco-friendly production method — is truly top notch when it comes to nailing the perfect baggy jean." — Sarah Wasilak, associate content director, Shopping

Best Cardigan From Reformation

Reformation Clara Cashmere Crew Cardigan ($198)

This classically chic cardigan comes in a rainbow of colors, including neutrals and bolder hues. And like the aforementioned boyfriend sweater, it's made from 95 percent recycled cashmere with a relaxed fit.

Best Denim Dress From Reformation

Reformation Kendi Denim Midi Dress ($218)

Narrowing down the best of Reformation's iconic dresses is no easy task, but this denim midi stands out for fall. Teamed with a belt, boots, and your favorite handbag, it's without a doubt double take-worthy.

Best Wedding Guest Dress From Reformation

Reformation Isa Knit Dress ($218)

Equally alluring with or without a belt, the Isa dress is on-trend with a wavy, plunging neckline and hardware that shapes and structures. While it's long and formfitting, making it appropriate for a black tie event, adding a belt or printed shoes can help dress it down for cocktail attire. Like many Ref pieces, it's also made from deadstock fabric and is dry clean only.

Editor Quote: "As someone who loves wearing color at weddings, I've never been so excited to wear all-black — or blown away by the compliments that ensued. It's also extremely comfortable and stretchy, which is in part thanks to the adjustable straps. As someone who's 5'1", I was pleased by the ankle length that allowed for a shoe moment. And while I chose platforms, I could've easily gotten away with a kitten heel." — SW

Best Special Occasion Dress From Reformation

Reformation Bryson Dress ($248)

If you need a special occasion dress, rest assured that Reformation has you covered. While you could easily spend an afternoon scrolling through all of the brand's elegant options, this beauty is a standout with its fitted bodice and A-line skirt. It's available in this eye-catching shade of cherry red and three floral prints.

Best Suede Bag From Reformation

Reformation Medium Patrizia Bag ($448)

Suede bags are a classic no matter the season, and this brown structured bowling bag is certainly no exception. It has silver hardware, a card holder, and zippered closure, but if that doesn't sound like enough room, there's a bigger version, too: the Oversized Patrizia Bag ($598). It's big enough to store a laptop and more.

Best Riding Boots From Reformation

Reformation Frances Knee High Boot ($498)

There's no rule saying you need to live anywhere near horses to rock a pair of riding boots (and honestly, you wouldn't want to wear these ones for that). These ones have a square toe, block heel, and knee-high height that will look so chic paired with a sweater minidress.

Best Leather Jacket From Reformation

Reformation Veda Bennett Oversized Leather Bomber ($658)

It's no secret that this leather jacket is quite the splurge, but it's the kind of piece you'll hold onto (and wear) forever. It's made of soft sheep leather and has distressed detailing that gives it a cool, lived-in look and adds an edge to all your ensembles.

— Additional reporting by Sarah Wasilak

Marisa Petrarca (she/her) is a contributing editor for PS Shopping and has over seven years of experience writing and editing beauty, fashion, and lifestyle content. She was previously the senior beauty editor at Grazia USA and the style and beauty editor at Us Weekly. Now freelancing, her work has been featured in Cosmopolitan, Allure, Marie Claire, and more.

Sarah Wasilak (she/her) is the associate director of PS Shopping. With plenty of experience in the fashion industry and over 10 years as an editor at the brand, she enjoys writing across the lifestyle, health, and fitness categories. She is the host of the "Dinner For Shoes" podcast and has bylines at InStyle, Elle, Refinery29, Who What Wear, Elite Daily, Byrdie, and The Quality Edit.
